intro: Ixodia angusta, commonly known as the narrowleaf desert lily, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, fleshy leaves and tall, spike-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers, which range from white to pink, bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ixodia angusta is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
